文献ID: STP1132-EB-Zirconium in the Nuclear Industry_9th Volume_043_chunk2
证据片段: Autoclave corrosion tests were conducted primarily on Zircaloy-4, although several scoping tests on sponge-grade $Z \mathbf { r }$ and $\mathsf { Z } _ { \mathsf { I } } { \mathsf { - } } 2 . 5 \mathsf { N b }$ were also performed. The $2 . 1 \mathrm { - m m }$ -thick sheets of recrystallized Zircaloy-4 contained $1 . 4 9 \ \mathrm { S n }$ . 0.20 Fe. 0.10 Cr. 0.145 O (in wt. $c _ { \mathit { \mathrm { / c } } }$ ) and impurity elements of $1 8 0 \mathrm { ~ C ~ }$ , 62 Hf, ${ < } 5 \mathrm { H }$ $< 3 5$ Ni. 78 Si, and $1 . 8 \mathrm { U }$ (in wt. ppm).
额外性质: {"thickness": "2.1 mm", "surface_treatment": "coarse (120 grit) and fine (600 grit) grinding, polishing, pickling", "pickling_solution": "3 Hf, 40 HNO3, 57 H2O (vol.%)", "measurements": ["surface nodule coverage", "weight gain", "particle distribution"]}

文献ID: STP1132-EB-Zirconium in the Nuclear Industry_9th Volume_043_chunk2
证据片段: Scoping tests on Zircaloy-4, sponge $\mathrm { Z r }$ , and $\mathbf { Z } \mathbf { r } { - } 2 . 5 \mathbf { N } \mathbf { b }$ , conducted at $5 0 0 \mathrm { { } ^ { \circ } C }$ for $^ { 2 4 \mathrm { ~ h ~ } }$ , illustrate the relative susceptibility of the materials to nodular corrosion (Fig. 1). Both asreceived and beta-quenched $\mathbf { Z r { - } } 2 . 5 \mathbf { N b }$ did not exhibit nodular corrosion, in contrast to significant nodule formation on Zr and Zircaloy-4 specimens.
